isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Dual Turbocharger and Exhaust Tubing - Removal - Exhaust Tubing

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, make sure that the engine has cooled down sufficiently before attempting to remove or perform maintenance repairs on any engine components. See "Safety Information."

figure.caption: Exhaust tube assembly to exhaust manifold mounting bolts (left side)

step1.para: Remove two bolts (M8 x 60) and nuts securing the exhaust tube assembly to the left exhaust manifold.
Use protective caps to cover all openings. See Cap Kit (all) Special Service Tools. If plastic caps are not available, use tape to cover openings.

figure.caption: Exhaust tube assembly to exhaust manifold mounting bolts (right side)

step1.para: Remove the two bolts (M8 x 60) and nuts securing the exhaust tube assembly to the right exhaust manifold.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death: Do not allow used engine fluids to stay on your skin. Clean your skin and nails with soap and water, or a good hand cleaner. Wash or properly throw away clothing or rags containing used engine fluids. Used engine fluids contain certain elements that may be unhealthy for skin and could even cause cancer. See "Safety Information."

note.para: Engine fluids, oil, fuel, and coolant, can be a threat to the environment. Collect and dispose of engine fluids according to state or local regulations.

step1.para: Remove the EGR cooler V-band clamp and EGR cooler gasket from the EGR cooler assembly.

figure.caption: Removing the turbocharger exhaust tube assembly

step1.para: Remove four turbocharger exhaust tube assembly bolts (M10 x 30).

figure.caption: Removing the turbocharger exhaust tube assembly gasket

step1.para: Remove the turbocharger exhaust tube gasket and discard.
